fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let A be a finite set equipped with a preorder ( \le ). There is a unique topology on A whose specialization preorder is \le.

fr:tree.fr:mainmatter: We know that the Alexandroff topology on A is finer than any topology whose specialization preorder coincides with \le, meaning any other such topology finer than it must be equivalent to it. Consider a topology \mathcal {T} on A whose specialization preorder coincides with \le. We need to show \mathcal {T} contains all upward closed subsets of A.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Non-Hausdorff topology and domain theory
